review_blob: 500 ml bottle. Dark reddish color. Huge head. Aromas of raspberries, blueberries and cherries, smells very refreshing. taste is raspberries, cocoa with blueberries and a slightly hoppy aftertaste. Dry finish. Not a huge fan of fruit beers but I dig this one! cheers
beer_name: Brasseurs du Monde Gamme Fruits Dark Ale aux Petits Fruits

review_blob: 341ml Bottle. Small long lasting head, pitch black color (Grande noirceur is right). Aromas of vanilla,lactose, resinous hops. In mouth, the grain dominates pretty much everything followed with dark chocolate flavors and bitterness. the finish is quite smooth. very good brew, cheers!

600ml Bottle. clear pear color with good looking head. Aromas of coriander, orange peel, lemon and bready belgian yeast. Taste is very delicate. Yellow fruits, slight floral hops flavor. Dry finish followed with a long but shy floral after taste. Very drinkable. Very good balance between the elements. Cheers!

750 ml bottle. the deScription alone got me interested a lot. Slightly hazy straw color with a quick head. It does smell like a blend. Citrus notes, yellow fruits and very spicy. I dont feel the oak in the aromas but In the taste, thats another story. Citrus notes followed acid taste which is not too hard, herbal aromas in the taste ends off on a dry finish. From the smell I thought it would be hard to go through the entire bottle but I was wrong. This beer is actually well brewed for the challenge it represents to do such a beer. At 15$ a bottle I was expecting more but thats just me. Have it a try, really cool stuff!
beer_name: Brasseurs du Monde Cuves du Chai Impriale Saison

review_blob: 341 ml. bottle. Hazy brown ruby color, light head. Aromas of smoke, brown sugars and caramel malts. Taste is strong barley, brown sugar with a little bitter aftertaste. Alcohol is very present and the mouthfeel is heavy. Perfect for a cold day. cheers!

473 ml can. nice lasting head with a light copper color. wow aromas of cookie, toffee, nuts, smells very earthy and some hops in the backgroud. flavors of toffee, nuts,figs. Kinda what I was expecting from the smell. smooth finish. the hops are sneaky but present... the balancing of everything is what makes that beer good in my opinion... no off-flavors. everything works hand in hand. Cheers!

500 ml bottle. heavy head that evaporates quickly. Mahogany color. Smell is sweet, brown sugar, caramel malts, and maple. okay ... I think we can all agree that there is no mushroom presence and im really disapointed about it because I thought it was a pretty clever idea... yet flavors of maple and caramel malts, dry finish, not bitter at all... as said from a previous person here ... feels like Im tasting an amateur brew. Im sure the recipe is good.. Seems to me the problem is in the brew methods.. the carbonation was not hanging in there at all and the yeast didnt seem to have done everything it could to round up that beer nicely. I might try it some other time to see if they can iron out the flaws. Cheers!

500ml bottle. I am starting to really dig this brewery, when I saw limited edition on the bottle I had to buy it. Clear caramel color with a HUGE head! Oh my god be careful when you poor it. at first, I smell some aroma hops that remind me lemons, oranges and other yellow fruits, followed by pepper. Taste is kinda shy a bit and the saison feel isnt quite there but still... tastes pepper and a bit acid. The finish and the aftertaste are also very shy but manages to be dry and hoppy. Maybe Im not drinking this beer at the right time? On a hot summer evening, it could get you drunk faster than you might realize! Not my favorite saison but manages to be good.

341ml Bottle. Dark ginger clear color with a beige head. Aromas of amber malts, candi sugar and notes of roasted wheat if Im not mistaken. taste is based on cereals, not too thick, not too dry. Roasty yet not agressive. I do not detect any hazelnut as described on the label but if its there, its very subtle. Not very hoppy but thats not what I was expecting from it. finale is somewhat dry and sweet. I like it but was expecting more because I dont really feel the yeasty belgian signature I was looking for.
beer_name: Brasseurs du Monde Gamme Connaisseur LAssoiff 8

review_blob: 350 ml can. To tell you the truh, this beer is kind of a guilty pleasure for me... It might be the only commercial beer I like. Very crisp, almost no aroma sadly, dry finish with a tint of biterness at the very end, no real flavors going for it but it feels like an ale for sure. When Im in a bar that has nothing but junk beers, Molson Export will be my pick

500 ml Bottle. Sunny yellow color with thin long lasting head. Aromas of grapfruits, pineapples that mostly comes from the floral hops. The aroma is pretty straight forward but good. The taste is very light to say the least. grapefruits, sugars, dry hoppy finish... pretty shy... average blonde that brings nothing special really..

Its about time I review this one! 750 ml 1 year old bottle! Golden straw color and massive sustained head! wow I smell a hoppy champain! Lemon/Citrus notes and ripe grapefruits. The better the beer is, the more speechless I get. Man THAT BALANCE! I may have a new beer in my top 5!
Floral hops are through the roof, a little sourness that joins the biterness and the fruityness. creamy finish. Great Stuff!!

500 ml bottle. Kinda muddy copper color, thick beige head. Aromas of mapple, ripe dark fruits, barley sugars and caramel. Tastes Barley sugars and caramel sweetness at first quickly followed by a tart and strong biterness/alcohol tag-team that you learn to appreciate after a few sips. A surprisignly dry hop finish for that beer. I like this kind of stuff and so should you! cheers

500 Ml bottle. So this is a 2014 edition... I doubt the floral hops character will still be there. Poors a slightly hazy straw golden color. with a HUGE head. The nose is lemon, acid, and hoppy (but like I suspected, most of the herbal presence is gone). Taste of tart saison yeast and watered down hop character. Im sure this beer is awesome when consumed young, but when aged, it loses all its charm. Quite good but do not age it

500 ml bottle. Color is a beautiful uniform brown like a dark mapple syrup. Beige thick and dense head. Aromas of nutmeg, brown sugar and a hint of licorice. This almost smells like a chirstmas beer. The alcohol presence is what I was expecting with this, not too shy but not too strong either. Caramel malts, brown sugar notes in the taste. The finish is a bit dry with a grainy aftertaste. You can also feel a bitterness presence but its kinda well hiden.This is a great beer but personally, I think the flavors are not present enough. Other than that I have nothing to say against it

341 ml bottle. Very clear beer but it has a nice head with lacing. Very herbal and hoppy in the aromas (which I was not expecting). Also notes of ripe pear and apples. Taste is quite watery sadly... The only thing I feel is a crisp bitter aftertaste... Is this beer really 6%?? I know why they call it infamous now... but joking aside its not bad at all. Just not impressive.

341ml Bottle. Hazy with average head. Aromas of orange peel, wheat bready yeast. Tastes is quite dull... orange and wheat yeast maybe some cloves too... small hop character in aftertaste and its the downfall of this beer cause its not floral at all and kinda harsh on the tongue. pretty generic if you ask me

600ml Bottle. Very pale lemon color and thin head. the first thing that comes to my nose is malt sugars an that is pretty much it.... Tastes like pils malts pretty much... no real hop character, good carbonation, dry finale but tasteless. Its not bad by any means but definately not great. probably better than many commerical lagers or pills on the market.

500ml Bottle. Super hazy Straw golden color. Thick head but the evaportation was quick. Aromas of fresh corriander, floral hops, yeast breadiness and orange zest. Smells great actually. Tastes very mellow and ripe. Wheat, corriander and orange zest. The downfall I cant think of is the abscence of any aftertaste. This beer is anything from being dry. The aromas hyped me up but that was about it... Id say average and a bit more maybe. Still worth drinking on a terrace with good friends!

341 ml bottle. Dark ruby color with very high carbonation. 1-2 finger beige head. Malty aromas at first, caramel and a hoppy feel that mostly comes from the magnum hops I guess.. Taste is quite the same, very malty yet not overwhelming. The high carbonation helps the taste that could feel quite dull in my opinion. For a 72 IBU beer, this is not too bitter, the grain are balancing this beer very well. Sticky warm aftertaste. Had my doubts about it but I was wrong. A bit simple but well brewed beer overall! cheers!
beer_name: Les Trois Mousquetaires S.S. Sticke Alt

review_blob: 500 ml. Bottle. Nice clear Ruby color with almost no head. I do smell the mapple. I also feel caramel malts and a bit of alcohol. The taste is what I expected with this one. mapple up front, sugars, woody, and a real mapple syrup feel in the thick aftertaste. It might be very average but I like mapple syrup so bad that I cant go wrong with this!! cheers

600 ml Bottle. Clean copper brown color and generous head. Herbal aromas, saison yeast with a hint of caramelised malts. Taste is quite Saison style with a touch of that special herb they put in, the sweet gale... ( have no clue what it is). The match with hops is quite interesting. This marriage is enjoyed mostly in the dry aftertaste! But a bit shy if you ask me. Ambitious one! keep it up!

660 ml Bottle. Dark golden, clear copper color. Good head, nice lacing. Aroma is floral hops, pine, yellow fruits and you can feel that habenero pepper smell that is quite unique.Taste is floral hops, nice malty cereal sugars. Id say the pepper is less present in the taste, but you can feel it once you know its there. I wouldve liked it to be a bit more spicy but this is quite ambitious and well done!

500 ml Bottle. Pitch black accompanied with a thick layer of dark cream head. Nose is Belgian chocolate, vanilla, roasted malts and that oak/whisky wonderful aroma. Taste is thick and creamy. Roasty and a hint of vanilla quickly followed by a subtle whisky touch. The finish is quite dry to my surprise. mine is not so acid as many people claim. This is a blend of 2 beers so expect infected bottles I guess... Mine is perfect. This blend is Epic!

600 ml Bottle. Kind of yellow/white hazy color with quick lasting head. the smell is very acid ..... I can feel apple and oranges but not by much. Taste is pretty much the same.. I can taste the hints of honey they put in. Im kind of wondering if my bottle is infected...Its just too acid to be normal...Its sad I really wanted to enjoy that one... maybe another day

600 ml Bottle. Deep brown color with nice head almost as brown. The lacing is wonderful. The dark chocolate aroma is very present, sweet roasted malts, and dark cofee with a hint of alcohol. Taste is less strong than expected, not too thick either. in mouth you pick up more the roasty malts than the chocolate and gives an interesting dry finish. not over done yet very well brewed. 2 Thumbs up!!

500 ml Bottle. Color is gold/orange, nice frothy head with good lacing. Very floral aroma and fruity, oranges and peaches, the floral hop character is very appealing. The biterness is shy in mouth and gets higher to reach its maximum in the aftertste. Resinous, fruity and hoppy, not very complex but well executed ! thumbs up!
UPDATED: MAY 17, 2015

341ml Bottle. Dark brown color with red hue. Small head but persistent. Nose is strong cofee, moka, dark chocolate and a bit of alcohol gets through.. taste is smoother than expected. Chocolate, moka with an aftertaste less bitter than I was expecting. Might be a bit to strong on the alcohol levels but I guess this is what a russian Imperial stout is about. Good beer overall. I would love to see a barrel aged version of this (whisky/cognac/brandy barrel) !!

473ml Can. been a while since I,ve had a pale ale. Clear golden straw color with a nice layer of bubbles but evaporates quickly. Smell is pear and yellow ripe fruits, pineapple, the cascade hops gets trough and shines bright. very herbal and spicy. The taste is bit dull if you ask me. yellow fruits taste with a powerfull dry hop aftertaste nothing else really.. nothing else to say sadly. Ill probably never buy this again. I guess me and cans just dont go so well togheter.
beer_name: La Ft Cuve Houblonne Pale Ale Amricaine

review_blob: 341 ml bottle. Very dark brown color with small red reflections. Average brown head. smell is of course smoke, wood, treacle and roasted malts. the taste is very smoky!! a bit ticky, this feels like an imperial stout. tobacco, maple wood, caramelised malts and a good bitter aftertaste. the malts might be too present for its own good I think. a bit less malts with that same woody smoke flavor wouldve been awesome I think. Really good but could get improved. Cheers

750 ml. 2013. Dark red ruby color with a big head of large brown bubbles. Sour and citrus notes, cookie malts, very spicy, honey notes in background. Wow ! delicous... Ripe fruits, oranges, that saison breadiness feel, the sweet malts are very present followed by a floral aftertaste. If you dont like sweet beers, you might not like this, but you should try it any how! Very silky and mellow, the yeast has done a remarkable job over the year and half sitting at the bottom of that bottle. I definitely recommend aging that beer. Very well done! two thumbs up
beer_name: Brasseurs du Monde Srie Millsimes Saison Impriale

review_blob: 500ml Bottle. Pitch black color with very dark brown heavy head. Smells cofee, candied fruits, roasted malts (smells very grainy actually) a bits of yeast also. tastes roasty yet not to bitter( grain biterness). cofee and dark chocolate presence. cool dry finish, with a well hidden alcohol level. Not my favorite but worth cheking!

500 ml Bottle. bottle 3467 out of 3500(end of batch). Very dark brown body with loads of beige foam on top. Smell is aromatic hops, oranges, a bit of roasted malts. simple but well done. Taste is dark chocolate, roasted malts and cofee, resinous fruity hop aftertaste! Above average. I would recommend it very young, it might be much better!

341 ml bottle. Ive had the DH version before thet regular one. Clear copper color. nice head. Smell is less hoppy than the DH. pine notes and bready. iron odor too. taste is hops, bread, crisper than expected. not sticky. overall good american IPA but the DH version is way better in my books
beer_name: Simple Malt Cascade India Pale Ale

review_blob: 750ml Bottle. Cloudy amber color with a 1-2 finger beige head. It has low carbonation. The hops aroma gets to you first and then comes pepper notes and those smoked malts. Taste is not what I expected from the smell but quite delicious. Biterness that comes from the hops and the malts. also quite fruity and floral. apricots esters to a dry yet gummy finish, The cherry wood can be detected in the aftertaste! Yep! two thumbs up
beer_name: Pit-Caribou Ltoile du Brasseur Vin dorge

review_blob: 500 ml bottle. Dark brown color with a thick creamy head and good lacing. Blackberry smell followed by oathmeal. Some dark fruits esters too. Nice little stout but pretty generic . Taste is rosted malts and oatmeal . A bit shy but I like it! Check it out!

500ml Bottle. Clear yellow/champaign color. Small head but very nice lacing. Smell is very hoppy and salty followed by an acidulous smell that is to be expected since this beer is vinified. Low carbonation (again to be expected) . The taste is wonderfull. Bitter hops/ Floral Hops followed by grape fruits sugars with a crisp bitter aftertaste. it gives you that nice feeling in the back of your tongue. Really great product! feels like an IPA but with something more going for it . Very very dangerous for a 10% abv beer!! Be carefull with it. I saw the abv after my first sip and I was shocked. If you like hops ... This beer is definitely for you!! Cheers!!

341ml Bottle. Very dark brown color with a little red hue. Creamy beige head. Smell is very sweet. Cane sugar, gingerbread and maybe a bit of black licorice Id say. Yep! great christmas beer. Good carbonation. Taste is very creamy and sweet. Tastes cane sugar along with strong spices followed by rosted malts in the aftertaste. Id say its pretty good for what it is. I had low expectations, then again I was wrong! Good beer. check it out!
beer_name: Multi-Brasses Le Ptit Buck Au Nez Rouge

beer_brewer_name: Microbrasserie Le Castor - Le Castor Brewing Co.
review_blob: 660 Ml Bottle. hazy light caramel color, high head but quick evaporation. Carbonation is not very high. This smells like christmas! at first you smell the belgian yeast and the sugar that would most likely come from dates and figs. After you may smell the Malt presence as a backbone in the aromas. the taste is a bit more shy than expected. I taste buiscuit malts, quickly followed by the dates sugar and dark fruits. The alcohol is not very well hidden but for a winter beer that shouldnt a be a flaw. not really spicy to tell you the truth... yeah.. Truly, I expected more of this beer but its not bad at all. it is what they advertise and it is still worth checking ! cheers!
beer_name: Le Castor Dubbel dHiver (aux fruits secs)

review_blob: 750ml bottle. very clear golden color and a beautiful 1 finger head. I detect a citrus smell followes by spices and dominent malts (wheat and barley). taste is pretty much the same. the maple syrup is not very noticable. still.. manages to be very good
beer_name: Dunham / Kissmeyer La Rsurrection de Broderus

review_blob: 750ml Bottle. VERY dark black color with a nice foamy brown roasted head. the aroma is amazing! : roasty malts, dark fruits, cherrys, cofee, dark chocolate and maybe brown sugar. the taste does not dissapoint. roasty! very grainy yet not too strong, a bit bitter, also tastes chocolate. the beer is smooth and thicky. for a 9.3%ABV the alcohol is very stealth! be carfull! wow this is amazing !!! cheers! Dig up for that Gem!

500 ml bottle.. Damn... low ratings is the name of the game on this one... Ill try to give an honest review about it without considering other reviews. Slight hazy orange coppery hue and a thin head. Residual cake fruit sugars combined with caramel malts. it does smell like cookie malts. mouthfell is chocolate cookie but very shy... to tell you the truth it doesnt taste very much....no after taste and no spice feel whatsoever. the aroma is better than the taste. its not as bad as everyone says... I could drink this any day no problem. not my favorite christmas beer by any means but still manages to be drinkable and enjoyable... Have I fell on another batch ? Do they have bottling problems? I dont know but it passes for me .. Christmas is here and I wish you all happy christmas beer time!!!

500ml bottle. Oh my gosh.. Its very effervescent! be carefull when you poor it. very high carbonation. Slightly hazypale yellow beer. the aroma is yeasty and spicy with citrus notes. Nice little Saison here. apricots and spices are very present in the tatse and the hop in background makes this holds very well in mouth. a bit shy to me but thats the only downside I can think of (thats not saying much because I had a couple IPAs before this one)

500 ml Bottle. highly carbonated clear orange color with a big beige head and nice lacing. smell is hops and fruity sugars. If I had to guess the kind of hops... I would say Fuggle hops. nothing much out of the ordinary but this is exactly what I expected from it. taste is crispy yet sticky in the aftertaste, very nice biterness. typical but very good. I never had the regular version. Id like to see the difference! cheers!
beer_name: Simple Malt Cascade DH India Pale Amricaine

review_blob: 750Ml bottle. Clear dark brown with small beige head. roasty malts aroma with dark chocolate and dark fruits. quite new toBrasseurs sans gluten. taste is cofee, chocolate, rosted cereals and alcohol a bit too much Id like. the beer is very thick, almost like a syrup. Not bad but not very good either... the bottle hyped me up but the beer itself disapointed me... still worth cheking ! cheers

341ml Bottle. foamy hazy golden/beige color. smell is belgian yeast, Hop and vanilla. wow! belgian IPA is right! very hoppy but not too bitter, dry yeasty finish! not very carbonated and the palate is medium. you can feel pepper notes in the aftertaste. I like that kind of mix! nice blend!
beer_name: Les Brasseurs du Temps Carpe Diem

review_blob: 341ml bottle. big shiny white head of dense bubbles. Hazy straw color. in the aroma the lemon is dominant if I had to guess the spice... corriander. and of course pepper. smell is quite refreshing but mostly citrus like. wow this saison is really unique!! Taste is spicy/lemony, but to tell you the truth this feels belgian like with a good yeatsy/malts bready backbone!! the pepper is almost absent from the tatse sadly and the citrus taste is a bit redundant. otherwise great beer
beer_name: lAbri de la Tempte Palabre 3 (Saison Rustique)

review_blob: 750ml Bottle. very dark brown reddish color. has an average head well sustained. sweet malts odor followed by apricot and melted sugars. taste is a bit hoppy (more than expected)and a bit resinous. The alcohol is very present, but the caramel malts are dominent in this one. followed by a rosted flavor and a dry bittersweet finish. Not perfect by any means but still a good mention in the realm of Barley wines
beer_name: Les Brasseurs du Temps Mea Magna Culpa

review_blob: 500Ml Bottle. poors a clear amber orange color, very thick sustained head . smell is quite floral with some kind of spices. also have that iron smell to it. quite shy to tell you the truth a bit bitter in the after taste and a bit of floral sweetness to it. to tell you the truth I expected more comming from this brewery.... still not bad and achieves to make me want to drink it all, but its most likely that Im not going to buy it again
